The impact on model utility, illustrated in Figure 4b for Llama on synthetic data (with complete results in Figure 7), demonstrates significant robustness of Obliviate with a negligible effect on model utility.
Contrary to initial intuition, even the most aggressive stride setting of 1 (modifying every token) maintains model utility with minimal degradation.

A closer examination reveals that this behavior is explained by the probability distribution of each token remaining similar with respect to the top 9 probabilities during unmemorization (after removing the target token).
We hypothesize that maintaining this distribution over the top 9 probabilities is what helps the model preserve its utility.
To further validate this hypothesis, we tested unmemorizing with a stride of 5 without applying the maintain loss Lmaintain.
